result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHRISTOPHER L BROTT

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM Defendant CHRISTOPHER L BROTT in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for CHRISTOPHER L BROTT.  Attorney Scott Zehr in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing in 22CF235.
Officer McLaughlin sworn and testifies. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Exhibit #1 offered and received. 

Court finds probable cause and bindings defendant over for further proceedings. 
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHRISTOPHER L BROTT in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for CHRISTOPHER L BROTT. 
Received offer. No resolution. 
Preliminary hearing to be scheduled with the JA. 
Bond continued.

BOND TO COVER 22CF235 & 22CM84
No contact with Victims or their residences.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHRISTOPHER L BROTT in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for CHRISTOPHER L BROTT. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHRISTOPHER L BROTT in court. 
To be recalled when Attorney Thorson appears.
